title: Ticket #1722: Fix condor_nmi_submit to handle unknown platforms
description: Fix condor_nmi_submit such that if it is asked to build a platform it knows nothing about (meaning it is not present in any build or test set AND it isn't in the %submit_info hash table at all), it'll choose the default_nmi_platform platform which is very clipped and likely to build.
remarks:
2010-Oct-21 10:37:17 by psilord:
I've done a bunch of hacking and am now testing.

2010-Oct-27 11:30:55 by psilord:
The due date slipped because it turns out that Becky didn't actually want this specific feature right now and I had worked on the wrong thing. So, during the slippage time, I had implemented Becky's actual request. However, the work for this ticket is basically finished, so I'm committing it anyway on account of it being a good feature none the less.
check_ins: 2010-Oct-27 15:16   Check-in [19239]: This checkin implements two features: 1. If an unknown platform identifier is presented to --platforms, the 'default_minimal_platform' platform configuration is chosen for it out of the %submit_info hash table in SubmitInfo.pm. No attempt is made to ensure that this unknown platform is actually available [...] (By Peter Keller )
